title: Can Shaolin monks fight in real life hand-to-hand combat? - Quora

response.answer_text: Likely they could clap most untrained people's cheeks and do handstand pressups over their groaning prostate form. If against seasoned trained fighters like pro MMA fighters or boxers they would not really be so well off…the best could theoretically ‘win’ but not unharmed. Plus you said hand-to-hand which also allows weapons used in close range combat (staffs,swords etc.)not unarmed (bare handed) So give an monk an staff,sword or spear and they become an hell of an lot harder to beat,unless you have an gun…

Yes, they are in good shape, flexible, strong, and have some good techniques. Good for fighting against average folk. Maybe even for beating a few average folk at once. But they would probably get their ass kicked by a BJJ blue belt or someone who does amateur MMA.
Oh most certainly. Hand to hand combat, purely for self defense, was the primary function of the Shaolin student or priest.
Umm… yea. Pretty much anyone with hands can fight in real life hand to hand combat. I don’t see why a monk couldn’t.
